intro: Eremophila shonae subsp. shonae, commonly known as the Narrow-leaf Emu Bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and efficient water use. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of South Australia. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
